summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Charles Thone. The documents primarily concern the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) final determination notifications regarding the release of HSCA (House Select Committee on Assassinations) staff payroll records. These notifications often involve the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. The documents also include payroll records, personnel records, correspondence, fingerprint analysis reports, and background checks related to HSCA staff and applicants. The documents focus on the administrative and legal processes surrounding the release of information related to the HSCA, rather than the activities or findings of the committee itself.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Charles Thone has no significance in the JFK context.
